Posts.Content: Hi Helen, thanks for getting back to me. I hope things go well with your results. From my experience so far there are no guarantees. Things can change depending on the discussion at the MDT, I suppose that’s what they are there for and to make sure nothing is missed or misinterpreted. When I went back to have my drain out the results were available they hadn’t be discussed fully. For a couple of weeks I was under the happy illusion that no further action was required, not even tamoxifen. Now it will be back to theatre again and waiting for the next pathology report, however I am hoping that nothing untoward will be found. The surgeon did say statically things like this usually turn out to be nothing. Sounds like your story is similar to mine, I wasn’t expecting the subject of radiotherapy to come up at this stage. I did ask the question about implants and radiotherapy going together and was told it was not contraindicated but there would be an increased risk of capsular contracture. The problem is that you have to make decisions based on what you know as you go along and the most of the time you can’t go backwards. We weren’t expecting this hiccup! Keeping my fingers crossed for you today and hoping the results are good. Andy X

Posts.Content: Hi, I’m new to this forum. I was diagnosed with 2 invasive tumours in February through the screening programme. They were both very tiny (one ductal and one lobular) but still ended up with a right mx, reconstruction with implant and SLNB. Everything was excised and the node clear, so I feel very lucky that this had been found and dealt with. Just as I’m starting to come to terms with the new me, there is more news. It’s now 8 weeks after the mx and I’ve been told that there was an ambiguous result from the biopsy of the nipple bed in the form of LCIS and the MDT recommends removing the nipple and that I may need radiotherapy depending on the histo, but I will need to decide if we go ahead with this plan. There is also the option of creating a pseudo-nipple out of skin? How does this work and is it worth it? Any advice appreciated.
